isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - DEEP REDUCTION AIR SYSTEM: 8-SPEED "LL" MODELS ONLY

svcproc.title: DEEP REDUCTION AIR SYSTEM: 8-SPEED "LL" MODELS ONLY

svcsubproc.title: Troubleshooting
svcsubproc.para: If the transmission fails to shift or shifts too slowly to or from LO-LO, the fault may be in the Deep Reduction Air System or related components of the Range Shift Air System.
To locate the trouble, the following checks should be made with normal vehicle air pressure supplied to the system, but with the engine off.

note.para: It is assumed that correct PSI readings were obtained from the air filter/regulator and all air lines have been checked for leaks.

svcsubproc.title: For Models Equipped with the Deep Reduction Valve

step1.para: Air Supply. With the gear shift lever in neutral, loosen the connection at the INLET (End Port) of the Deep Reduction Valve until it can be determined that CONSTANT AIR is supplied to the valve. Reconnect air line.

If there is NO AIR, check for a restriction in the line between the Deep Reduction Valve and slave valve, making sure this line is connected to the tee fitting at the Supply or "S" Port of the slave valve.
Deep Reduction Valve. With the gear shift lever in neutral, disconnect the air line leads from the OUTLET of the Deep Reduction Valve.

step2.para: WHILE IN LOW RANGE, move the Deep Reduction Valve Lever to the "IN" position. There should be NO AIR flowing from disconnected line.

Move the valve lever to the OUT" position. There should now be CONSTANT AIR flowing from the disconnected line. Return the valve lever to the "IN" position to shut off air flow and reconnect air line.

step1.para: Reduction Cylinder ( Figure 9). If any of the seals in the reduction cylinder assembly are defective, the deep reduction shift will be affected. The degree of air lost will govern the degree of failure, from slow shifting to complete shift failure.

step2.para: Leak at O-ring A results in a slow shift to engage deep reduction gearing; pressurizing of transmission case; deep reduction gearing can be disengaged.

Leak at O-ring B results in slow shifting or complete failure to engage and disengage deep reduction gearing; steady flow of air from exhaust port of Deep Reduction Valve when lever is in the "IN" position.
Leak at gasket C results in a slow shift to disengage deep reduction gearing; steady flow of air to atmosphere.

svcsubproc.title: For Models Equipped with the Master Control Valve A-5015

step1.para: Air Supply ( Figure 10). With the gear shift lever in neutral, select LOW RANGE and loosen the connection at the "H" Port of the control valve until it can be determined that AIR is supplied to the valve. Reconnect the air line.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Master Control Valve Air Supply

step1.para: If there is NO AIR, check for a restriction in the 1/8 inch O.D. air line between the control valve and slave valve, making sure this line is connected to the tee fitting at the Low Range or "L" Port of the slave valve.

Roadranger Valve. With the gear shift lever in neutral, disconnect the 1/8 inch O.D. air line at the Center Port of the reduction cylinder cover, making sure this line leads from the "SP" Port of the control valve.

step2.para: WHILE IN LOW RANGE, move the Deep Reduction Button FORWARD. There should be AIR flowing from the disconnected line. Move the button REARWARD to shut off air flow and reconnect the air line.
If the preceding conditions did not exist, the control valve is defective, or there is a restriction in the air lines.

step1.para: Reduction Cylinder ( Figure 11). If any of the seals in the reduction cylinder assembly are defective, the deep reduction shift will be affected. The degree of air lost will govern the degree of failure, from slow shifting to complete shift failure.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Master Control Valve Reduction Cylinder

step2.para: Leak at O-ring A results in a slow shift to engage deep reduction gearing; pressurizing of transmission case; deep reduction gearing can be disengaged.

Leak at O-ring B results in slow shifting or complete failure to engage and disengage deep reduction gearing; steady flow of air from the exhaust port of control valve and/or cylinder cover when Deep Reduction Button is in the FORWARD position.
Leak at gasket C results in a slow shift to disengage deep reduction gearing; steady flow of air to the atmosphere.

step1.para: Insert Valve. Any constant flow of air from the exhaust port of the cylinder cover usually indicates a faulty insert valve. Exhaust should occur ONLY BRIEFLY when Deep Reduction Button is moved FORWARD WHILE IN LOW RANGE.
A faulty insert valve, leaking at the O-rings of the valve O.D. or from inner seals will result in shift failure. Two indications of defective O-rings or seals are:

step2.para: CONSTANT AIR flowing from the exhaust port of the cylinder cover.
CONSTANT AIR flowing from the exhaust port E" of the control valve WHILE DEEP REDUCTION BUTTON IS REARWARD (providing the control valve is operating properly).

svcsubproc.para: The three O-rings in position on the valve O.D. can be replaced. However, if an inner seal is damaged, the complete assembly must be replaced.
